body.p:
To His Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner Porter Johnson respectfully states, that at the term of the city court of Louisville he was indicted for an assault and battery, which he committed on Jeff. Mosly, alias, Jeff Short. his father E P Johnson gave bond in the sum of $100- that he would appear and answer, to an Indictment at the next Term of said court. Your Petitioner started on a Coal boat, down the river, intending to return to Lousville in time to appear at the trial, but he was greatly Exposed on the river and was taken sick at Paducah and was unable to return home, at the next term, and his bail bond was forfeited, and a Sci Fa, issued at him, and his Father. A few days ago he returned home (as soon as he was well enough) and the Marshal served the writ on him, in case of Indictment & Sci Fa- when he was at his home sick in bed, and he is now very unwell, The said Indictment was tried, on the 14th inst, and the Jury fined him Seventy five dollars, which sum he replieved costs & amounting to $93.15. The Sci Fa was then dismissed at Defts Costs, which amounts to $10.55 He states that, Said Mosly alias Short, was at a house, rented by his Father, to a woman named Dashea Bowes, who is the aunt of said Mosly, and he Mosly lived at said house with a notorious prostitute His Doshea Bowes kept a house of prostitution, and as soon
as his Father ascertained their character he gave them notice to move, and Ejected them from the premises- one night, at said house, then was a fuss and much noise, and Petitioner's Father sent him to stop the fuss and present injury to his house, whilst his Father went, after a Police officer to quell the difficulty and before his Father came with an officer, he got into a difficulty with this man Mosly. At the time of said trial he was too unwell to prepare for such defense as he could have made. Short, alias, Mosly is a man who lives in houses of Prostitution, who does no work and who is suspected of passing & uttering counterfeit money for a livelihood. He sleeps & east regularly in such a house. He could Easily have proved him worthy of credit before oath, had he been well enough to prepare for trial. He does not think that he has done an any injury To the community by assaulting Mosly- and he knows that the Dignity of Kentucky is a perfect stranger to him. Petitioner is a young man, and poor. Wherefore he asks for a remission of said fine the costs in both cases being heavy

I am a police officer in the District in which the petitioner lives and know that his Father Edward Johnson called at the Engine house for an officer & I went to his house with him but when we got there the difficulty & fuss was over

Jesse F Harmon
J. A. Weatherford
A Gilmore
B F Moore
Jno Doup
H. Lauer

Louisville City Court
Respite 12 mos
B. M
$100
$75 }
Porter Johnson
Issd Feby 21. 1860
